content.en: Scientists say elephants have names! How do they know this?
content.tw: 科學家說大象有自己的名字! 他們怎麼知道的呢?

content.en: We can hear some elephant sounds. Here's a loud sound. They make low sounds too. Here's a low sound.
content.tw: 我們可以聽到大象的叫聲，牠們可以叫很大聲，也可以發出低沉的聲音。

content.en: Elephants also make VERY low sounds. Our ears can't hear them! With these very low sounds, they call each other. They use a different sound for each elephant. That different sound is the elephant's name!
content.tw: 大象還會發出我們聽不到、非常低沉的聲音來稱呼彼此，不同的聲音就是不同大象的名字。

content.en: This is very cool. Many people think only humans use names to call others. That's wrong!
content.tw: 很多人以為只有人類才會用名字呼叫對方。

content.en: How do people know we are talking to them? Many times, we use their names. When we see our friends, we say "Hi, Johnny" or "Hello, Emma."
content.tw: 人們怎麼知道我們在跟他們說話呢? 因為我們會稱呼他們的名字。

content.en: An elephant has about fifty friends. It uses names for them too! An elephant can also call a friend from six kilometers away. Many elephants can hear that call. Using a name is important then.
content.tw: 一隻大象差不多有50個朋友，牠還會用不同的名字呼叫。大象可以從6公里外呼叫朋友，很多同伴都聽得到，所以知道在叫誰很重要。

content.en: Scientists are going to keep studying elephant sounds. Maybe we will learn that elephants talk to each other! And who knows? Maybe one day, we can call their names and talk to them!
content.tw: 科學家將繼續研究大象的聲音。也許我們會知道大象之間會互相交談！誰知道呢？也許有一天，我們可以用牠們的名字來稱呼牠們，並與牠們交談！

vocabulary.preface: 大象不但記憶力驚人，還會互相呼叫名字。

content.text:
1. call 叫做
What's that new guy's name? 新來的那人叫什麼名字?
I don't know. I just call him Chief. 我不知道。我都叫他酋長。
Why "Chief?" 為什麼是酋長?
He said he's a fan of the Kansas Chiefs.他說他是堪薩斯酋長隊的粉絲。

2. talk 交談
So when you talk to him, you say, "Hey, Chief."
所以你跟他講話時就說，「嗨，酋長」。
Yeah, it's easy to remember. 對，很容易記。

3. friend 朋友
Then what does he call you? 那他怎麼叫你?
"Hey, My Friend." 就是「我的朋友」。
That's quite friendly. 倒是很友善。

4. use 使用
But I want him to use my name. 不過我想要他用我的名字。
Maybe you need to use his first. 也許你得先用他的。

vocabulary.postscript:
一起來讀單字。
call叫做
talk交談
friend朋友
use使用

title: Scientists Say It's Raining More… And Less

content.en: Do your mom and dad say it's raining more? Because of climate change, it is. Air holds more water in our warmer world.
content.tw: 你爸媽有說過雨越下越多嗎?沒有錯，因為氣候變遷的關係，氣候暖化讓空氣中有更多的水分。

content.en: Scientists say it's raining much more during wet times, and much less during dry times. And these changes are causing problems.
content.tw: 科學家說雨季的雨水越來越多，乾季越來越乾燥，這些變化都會造成問題。

content.en: Too much rain can cause floods. There's too much water everywhere. Heavy rain and floods damage farmers' crops. They damage homes, roads, and bridges. Floods keep us from leaving our homes or schools. Flood water is dirty and can make us sick!
content.tw: 雨太大會造成水災，會破壞農作物、家園、道路跟橋梁，我們只能待在家裡或學校。水災的髒水還會讓人生病。

content.en: Too little rain can cause droughts. There's too little water for everything. Droughts hurt farmers. They need lots of water to grow crops. In Taiwan, droughts hurt some technology companies. They need lots of water to make their products. And droughts hurt us! We need water for a healthy life!
content.tw: 雨太少會引起乾旱。乾旱讓農作物無法生長，也影響科技公司製作產品，還會影響我們的健康。

content.en: We can't stop floods or droughts. But we can all help Taiwan have a little more water every day. We can take shorter showers. We can turn off the water when we brush our teeth or wash dishes.
content.tw: 我們沒辦法阻止水災或乾旱，但我們可以每天為台灣省多一點水，洗澡洗快一點，刷牙、洗碗的時候把水關掉。

content.en: Can you think of more ways?
content.tw: 你能想到更多方法嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 雨水太多會造成水災，不夠的話又變成旱災。

content.text: 1. too much 太多 It's raining like crazy out there! 外面的雨下得真瘋狂! Yeah, just yesterday I was worried about my tomatoes getting too much sun.
2. too little 太少 Now it's too much water.現在是水太多了。But when there's too little rain 但是雨水太少的時候…I would be worried too.我又會擔心。
3. farmer 農夫 I really don't want to grow anything anymore. 我真的什麼都不想種了。I'm not a good farmer. 我就不是好農夫。
4. problem 問題。Hey, blame it on climate change. 要怪氣候改變吧。It's the weather that's causing problems, not you.

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like rain? 一起來讀單字。too much太多too little太少farmer農夫problem問題

2. What can too little rain cause?
3. What can we do to save water?

title: Kids in Taiwan Need More Exercise

content.en: Narrator: In Taiwan, many kids from eleven to thirteen years old took a survey. Seventy percent said they needed more exercise. Kids: What?/Huh?!/No way! Narrator: You know what? They're right!
content.tw: 台灣很多11歲到13歲的小朋友填問卷調查，有百分之70的說他們需要運動。他們說的沒錯!

content.en: Kids from five to seventeen years old need one hour of exercise a day. That's seven hours of exercise a week!
content.tw: 5到17歲的孩童需要每天運動1小時，一周要7個小時。

content.en: Kids have PE. But at most schools, PE is eighty to ninety minutes a week.
content.tw: 雖然學校有體育課，但大多數一周只上80到90分鐘。

content.en: Exercise can help kids be healthier. We can get exercise by doing things to move more. We can take the stairs, walk the dog, or ride a bike.
content.tw: 運動可以讓兒童更健康。我們可以多動動，像是走樓梯、遛狗或騎腳踏車。

content.en: Right now, it's too hot outside. The summer heat is strong. But - there are many ways to exercise inside! We can dance, swim, jump rope, play badminton, do taekwondo, or hula hoop!
content.tw: 外面現在真的太熱了，還是有很多方法可以在室內運動，例如跳舞、游泳、跳繩、打羽毛球、打跆拳道或搖呼拉圈。

content.en: Neighbor: Hey! Quiet down! Narrator: We need some space! We want to be safe, and we don't want to make people angry when we exercise at home!
content.tw: 我們需要安全的空間做運動。我們也不想在家做運動的時候，惹怒其他人。

content.en: Do you exercise one hour a day? No? Why are you sitting? If your teacher says okay, go and move!
content.tw: 你每天運動一小時嗎？沒有？為什麼你坐著？如果你的老師說可以，那就去動起來！

vocabulary.preface: 一個星期兩三堂的體育課，對兒童和青少年是不夠的。

content.text:
1. exercise 運動
Wendy, let's go rollerblading at the park this afternoon.

2. healthier 更健康
No, I need to study.

3. hour 鐘頭
Still, experts say you need to work out for one hour every day.

4. swim 游泳
Alright, I'll go swimming all by myself!

What kind of exercise do you like?
exercise運動
healthier更健康
hour鐘頭
swim游泳

title: No Cows Needed for This Butter

content.en: Mmm … Toast and butter, yum! Most butter is made from cow's milk. But a company has a new way to make butter.
content.tw: 烤土司加奶油真好吃! 大多數的奶油是用牛奶做的，現在有一間公司有新的方式做奶油。

content.en: It uses carbon dioxide and other gases that come from the air. It heats the gases. That makes the fat for the butter. No cows are needed!
content.tw: 這間公司加熱空氣中的二氧化碳跟其他氣體，做出奶油中的脂肪，完全不需要乳牛。

content.en: But why are they making butter this way? Well, cows create a lot of pollution. They belch methane. Methane is a bad gas. It makes the Earth warmer. Cows also need lots of land to live on and water to drink. Using cow's milk for butter is bad for the Earth.
content.tw: 為什麼要這麼做呢?因為牛會排出甲烷，讓地球暖化。養牛也需要很多的土地跟水。用牛奶做奶油並不環保。

content.en: The company says its butter is a much better butter for the Earth. It doesn't make bad gases. It doesn't need land. It uses very little water.
content.tw: 這間公司說他們的奶油不需要土地，也不會排出不好的氣體，只需要少量的水，是環保的奶油。

content.en: This new butter tastes like... butter! But is it safe to eat? The butter is being checked now. If it's safe, the company can start selling it in 2025.
content.tw: 這款新的奶油吃起來就像奶油，但是它吃下肚不會有問題嗎? 這種奶油還在檢驗中，如果通過檢驗，公司就可以在2025年開始販售。

content.en: So.... when you put butter on your toast, remember: soon it might be made from air!
content.tw: 所以...當你把奶油塗在吐司上時，請記住：很快它可能就會是用空氣做成的！

vocabulary.preface: 這家公司是先合成人造脂肪，再用脂肪做出味道跟奶油很像的產品。

content.text:
1. made from 用什麼做的
Ummm, this shrimp tastes good! 這蝦真好吃!
I'm glad you like it. 我很高興你喜歡。
It's made from algae.它是海藻做的。
What? This is not real shrimp? 什麼啊?這不是真的蝦子?
Nope.不是。

2. way 方式
But it looks and tastes like real shrimp! 但是它看起來跟味道都像真的。
I know. 我知道。
They used a new way to make it. 他們用一種新方法做的。

3. better更好的
I have to say they did a good job.我得說他們做得很好。
Better than the real one? 比真的還好?

4. create 創造
Probably not. But good enough. 也許沒有，但是夠好了。
Still, I hope they stop creating fake food. 不過我還是希望他們停止做假的食物。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字你記住了嗎?
made from 用什麼做的
way方式
better更好的
create創造

2. What do cows produce that is bad for the Earth?
3. If the new butter is safe, when can the company sell it?

content.en: That's a mascot cheering at a baseball game. The mascot is the cute animal or the cool superhero dancing around. Mascots make fans loud and excited!
content.tw: 那個吉祥物正在為棒球比賽加油! 吉祥物可以是可愛的動物或是大英雄，他們會跳舞逗粉絲開心。

content.en: Being a mascot actor looks easy and fun. They dance, cheer, and do funny things.
content.tw: 當吉祥物的演員看起來很容易也很有趣。他們會跳舞、歡呼還會搞笑。

content.en: But the job can be hard. Mascot costumes are hot inside. During Taiwan's hot summer, the actors get very hot!
content.tw: 但這個工作很辛苦，吉祥物服裝裡面溫度很高，特別是台灣的夏天，演員會覺得非常熱!

content.en: But the costumes are expensive! The actors can't make them dirty. So they wear pants, shirts with long sleeves, and gloves.
content.tw: 這些服裝很貴，演員不能弄髒，所以他們還會穿褲子、長袖跟手套。

content.en: You can do it! You can do it! Go, go, go!!! T-E-A-M! Goooooo team! The actors dance and cheer for thirty minutes. Then they need to rest and cool down … Go team! Go team! Yeah! T-E-A-M! Goooooo team! Go team! Go team! Yeah! … and then they dance and cheer again!
content.tw: 吉祥物演員會蹦蹦跳跳歡呼30分鐘，然後就得休息，涼快一下，再繼續賣力表演。

content.en: Mascots make sports games more fun. And happy fans buy lots of cups, baseball caps, and more… with the mascot on it!
content.tw: 吉祥物讓運動更有趣，粉絲就會買很多吉祥物的周邊的商品，像是杯子、棒球帽等等。

content.en: Mascot actors give fans a great time. They help the team make money too.
content.tw: 吉祥物演員讓粉絲玩得盡興。他們也幫助球隊賺錢。

vocabulary.preface: 吉祥物演員必須吃苦耐勞，還得讓觀眾高興!

content.text:
1. game 比賽。
The Tigers are having a game tonight! 老虎隊今晚要比賽! Where? 在哪裡? Taipei Dome.台北大巨蛋。 Great! I've never watched a baseball game there.太棒了，我沒有在那裏看過棒球賽。
2. shirt 襯衫。(開關抽屜聲音) What are you looking for? 你在找什麼? My T-shirt that says "Tigers." 我的圓領衫，上面寫著老虎隊。 I didn't know you're a true fan. 我不知道你是真正的粉絲。
3. expensive 昂貴的。But wait, let me check the tickets. 等等，讓我看一下票。 Oh no, only the most expensive ones are left. 糟糕，只剩下最貴的。
4. cheer 歡呼加油。How much? 多少錢? $1,000 NT a piece.一千塊。 Woah! Let's cheer for them at home. 哇，我們在家裡替他們加油吧。 Yeah, with hotdogs and popcorn! 對，還要熱狗跟爆米花!

vocabulary.postscript: Do you like baseball games? game比賽 shirt襯衫 expensive昂貴的 cheer歡呼加油

quiz.question: 1. What do mascots do?
2. How long can the actors dance and cheer before they need to rest?
3. What makes the job hard in the summer?

content.en: Ghost Month is done.
content.tw: 農曆鬼月已經結束囉。

content.en: When a person's life is done, they might be put in a coffin. Then their family and friends say goodbye to them.
content.tw: 人的生命結束的時候，他可能會被放進棺材裏面。他的親友會再跟他道別。

content.en: Most coffins are long boxes. Most are made of wood. But sometimes the person has a very different coffin!
content.tw: 多數棺材是長長的木製箱子。不過有時候還是有特殊的棺材。

content.en: In Africa, Ghana makes fantasy coffins. They can look like something the person loved: a superhero lunch box, a golden lion, or a cool sports car! Or they can be about the person's job: a red pen for a teacher or bread for a baker!
content.tw: 西非國家迦納很會製作一些特殊的、是這個人會喜歡的棺材。像是超級英雄的便當盒、金色的獅子、很酷的跑車，或是跟職業有關，比如說老師用的紅筆、麵包師傅的麵包。

content.en: A UK company makes fantasy coffins too. Some look like skateboards or ballet shoes! Some look like trains, guitars, or cellphones!
content.tw: 英國有一家公司也會做特殊的棺材。有的像滑板、芭蕾舞鞋、火車、吉他甚至手機。

content.en: One man got an airplane coffin... before he needed it. He liked it very much. He wanted his friends to see it. So he had a big party! Ten years later, when his life was done, everyone remembered that happy party.
content.tw: 有個男子在他需要之前就拿到飛機棺材。他非常喜歡，也希望他的朋友都可以看到，所以舉辦了一場盛大的派對。十年後，他離開了，大家都還記得那個開心的派對。

content.en: Fantasy coffins make family and friends smile. People remember happy times with the person. For some, they're a great way to say goodbye.
content.tw: 奇幻棺材讓家人和朋友感到開心。人們會想起和逝者的快樂時光。對某些人來說，這是告別逝者的一個好方式。

vocabulary.preface: 特殊形狀的棺木，可以彰顯往生者最大的特色。

content.text: 1. look like 看起來像。 I think it's a great idea! 我覺得這真的是很棒的主意! What? 什麼呢? Coffins that look like animals, trains or sports cars. 模仿動物，火車或是跑車的棺木。
2. like 喜歡。 Sports cars, hmmm, that sounds a lot of fun! 跑車，聽起來真好玩! Well, I like the idea too.我也喜歡這個主意。 Imagine having an elephant coffin! 想想看，一個大象棺木!
3. remember 記得。 Wouldn't it be great? 可不是很棒嗎? It's a nice way to remember the people you love. 用這好方式來紀念你所愛的人。
4. say goodbye 道別。 And it can make saying goodbye less painful. 也可以讓道別比較不痛苦。Yeah, it will make family and friends feel better. 對，會讓親友感覺好一些。

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。 look like看起來像 like喜歡 remember記得 say goodbye道別

quiz.question: 1. What are most coffins made of?
2. What kind of coffins are there in Ghana?
3. Where is the company that makes fantasy coffins?

content.en: Deep in the earth, it's very, very hot.
In Taiwan, under Taitung, it's very, very, very hot! The water there is hot too. It's so hot that it makes lots of steam!
content.tw: 台東地底下的溫度非常高，地下水也很燙，會產生很多的蒸氣。

content.en: The hot water and steam come out of the earth. The hot water makes hot springs. Many people go to Taitung's hot springs. They sit and relax … ahh! Clouds of steam go up and away.
content.tw: 熱水跟蒸氣從地底下冒出來就變成溫泉。很多人會到台東泡溫泉放鬆。

content.en: Some companies had a big idea. They helped the Bunun people with a hot spring park. The companies will also use the steam in the earth. They will make green electricity. Green electricity means it's good for the earth!
content.tw: 有一些公司想到不錯的主意，他們幫布農族建了溫泉園區。這些公司也利用地熱發展綠能，對環境友善。

content.en: First, they made a deep hole. They are testing it now. The steam will try to get out. You can see this with a kettle at home.
content.tw: 首先他們鑽了一個很深的洞，試著讓蒸汽冒出來，就像是在燒開水。

content.en: In Taitung, when the steam gets out, it will spin a big wheel. The spinning wheel will make electricity. It can make electricity for 2,500 houses!
content.tw: 冒出來的蒸氣會讓渦輪轉動產生電能，可以讓 2500個家庭使用。

content.en: The heat deep in the earth can make lots of good things happen in Taiwan! Go, steam, go!
content.tw: 地球深處的熱能可以在台灣促成許多好事發生！蒸汽，加油！

vocabulary.preface: 地熱可以發電，也會產生溫泉。

content.text:
1. relax 放鬆。
Ah, it's so nice to soak in the hot spring! 泡溫泉真好!
Yeah, what a way to relax! 對啊，讓人放鬆的好辦法!

2. deep 很深的。
Does all this water come from deep underground? 這些熱水都從地底深處來的嗎?
I believe so.我相信是。
You can smell the sulfur. 你可以聞到硫磺味。

3. house 房屋。
I hope to live in a house with a hot spring. 我希望住在有溫泉的房子裡。That would be wonderful!
那太好了!
Can I go and visit? 我可以去拜訪嗎?

4. at home 在家。
I may not be at home. 我可能會不在家。
Why not? 為什麼呢?
Because it'll be too hot there. 因為那裡太熱了。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡泡湯嗎?來一起讀單字。
relax放鬆 deep很深的 house房屋 at home在家

2. Where does the water from the hot spring come from?
3. What will the companies use to make electricity?

title: Lost King Found on Social Media

content.en: Do you look at pictures of your family and friends on social media? Or do you look at funny pictures and animal videos?
content.tw: 你會在社群媒體上瀏覽朋友的照片嗎?還是看好笑的照片或動物影片呢?

content.en: Some people who like art look at art on social media. Maybe they're looking at a picture of a family. But if there's art in the picture too, the art lover sees the art!
content.tw: 藝術愛好者會在社群媒體瀏覽藝術，可能也會看家庭合照，但是假如藝術品出現在照片裡，他們一定會注意到。

content.en: That's how one man found a painting of a king. It is more than 400 years old. It was part of a set. Twenty-two paintings were in the set. But no one knew where the king's painting was. People thought it was lost.
content.tw: 有人就這樣找到一張國王的畫像。這張畫像有4百年的歷史，是一組22張畫像中的一張。沒有人知道這張畫像在哪裡，大家都以為這張畫早已失蹤。

content.en: But the painting wasn't lost! It was in a place where people have events. People take pictures at these events. Someone put one of these pictures on social media.
content.tw: 其實這張畫就掛在一個常辦活動的地方。活動當中常有人拍照，還會把照片上傳到社群媒體。

content.en: In the picture, the painting is on a wall behind some people. The painting is arched on top. The man remembered the paintings in the set. They had the same arched top! Was this the lost painting? Yes!
content.tw: 照片裡這張畫像就掛在人群後方的牆壁上。它有獨特的拱形畫框，這名男子記得這一組畫像都有一樣的畫框，所以就是遺失的畫像。

content.en: The man is excited and happy. He found the lost king!
content.tw: 這名男子又興奮又開心。他找到了失蹤的國王！

vocabulary.preface: 只因為看到一張照片，就找到了消失多年的畫像，真神奇!

content.text:
1. art 藝術。
There's a Taipei Art Expo going on now. 台北藝術博覽會正在進行。
An Art Expo? 藝術博覽會?
Yeah, you get to see a lot of paintings.對，你可以看到很多畫作。

2. painting 油畫。
I used to be very good at that. 我以前很擅長的。
At making paintings? 很擅長畫油畫嗎? Then you should go and see.
那你應該去看看。

3. art lover 藝術愛好者。
Many art lovers are ready to pay big money for the work.很多藝術愛好者都準備花大錢買作品。
I bet they are.一定是的。I wish I knew what people like…我希望知道他們喜歡什麼...

4. maybe 也許。
Maybe they'd like pictures of themselves. 也許他們會喜歡自己的畫像。You're right! People like to see their own faces! 說得對! 人們喜歡看自己的臉。

vocabulary.postscript: 請跟我讀單字。art藝術 painting油畫 art lover藝術愛好者 maybe也許

title: Good Health for Back to School

content.en: It's back to school for you! But! It's also back to catching colds... More sneezing and coughing are around you! But there are many ways to stay healthy.
content.tw: 嘿!該是你們回學校上課的時後囉! 但是隨著開學，越來越多身邊的人咳嗽和打噴嚏，你們也更加容易感冒，不過，有很多保持健康的好方法哦。

content.en: Listen up! What's the first thing to do before you eat? Well, you wash your hands! Using soap is important. You can't see the germs and viruses on your hands. But germs and viruses can make you sick. Water doesn't kill them... Soap kills them! When there's no soap and water, find some hand sanitizer.
content.tw: 聽著，吃飯前該做的第一件事情是什麼呢? 就是用肥皂洗手! 你看不到讓你生病的細菌和病毒，所以要用肥皂或是乾洗手消滅他們!

content.en: Next, eat healthy foods! Vegetables, fruits, and whole grains are good for you. Don't be picky! Take a bite of broccoli. One bite is better than no broccoli!
content.tw: 下一步就是要吃健康的食物啦! 蔬菜、水果還有全榖根莖類都會幫助你，不要挑剔! 咬一口花椰菜吧! 總比都沒有吃花椰菜來的好。

content.en: Finally, at the end of the day, it's bedtime. Thirty minutes before bedtime, turn off your TV and your computer. Put away your phone. That can help you sleep better. Get lots of sleep. Your body needs to rest and get ready for a new day!
content.tw: 最後，到了睡覺時間! 睡前 30 分鐘要關上電視、電腦，還有把手機拿開，這可以幫助你睡得更好，讓身體休息並為隔天做準備。

content.en: Wash your hands, eat healthy foods, and get lots of sleep, okay? Stay healthy out there, kids! Now, with clean hands, eat lunch!
content.tw: 洗手、吃健康的食物，並獲得充足的睡眠，好嗎？孩子們，保持健康！現在，用乾淨的手吃午餐吧！

vocabulary.preface: 開學了，正是培養健康生活習慣的好時機。

content.text:
1. bite 咬。
Wow, what's this? 哇，這是什麼?
Shrimp cooked with peas.蝦仁炒豌豆。
Here, take a bite. 來吃一口。
Hmmm, this is really tasty! 這真好吃!
Yeah? You like it? 是嗎? 你很喜歡?

2. healthy 健康的。
I sure do.我很喜歡。
Good! It's easy to cook, and very healthy too. 真好，它很容易做，又很健康。
Low in calories.熱量又低。

3. better than 比什麼好。
Can I have more? 我可以再多吃一點嗎?
Of course, you can have half of it.當然，你可以吃一半。
This is definitely better than hamburgers. 這絕對比漢堡好。

4. picky 挑剔的。
You're not picky, are you? 你不挑剔，對吧?
Not at all. I'll eat whatever dishes you make. 一點也不，你做什麼我都吃。

vocabulary.postscript:
Do you eat vegetables every day? 來一起讀單字。
bite咬
healthy健康的
better than比什麼好
picky挑剔的

quiz.question: 1. When is washing your hands the first thing to do?
2. What is good for you to eat?
3. What is good to do thirty minutes before bedtime?

content.en: Ahhhh! Milk is good for you. Most of the milk people drink comes from cows. This milk helps your bones and teeth become stronger.
content.tw: 牛奶對身體好，喝牛奶可以幫助骨頭跟牙齒強壯。

content.en: Last year, people in Taiwan drank 20 liters of milk each. But that's much less than people in Europe and Australia. Europeans drank 53 liters each. Australians drank 92 liters each!
content.tw: 台灣去年每人平均喝20公升的牛奶，比歐洲跟澳洲人少很多。歐洲每個人一年喝掉53公升，澳洲每人喝92公升。

content.en: Taiwan knows that milk is good for kids. So kids from three years old to twelve years old are getting free milk! They're getting it at school. More than one million kids in Taiwan are getting free milk. That's a lot of milk!
content.tw: 台灣知道牛奶對兒童的身體好，所以3到12歲，一共超過100萬個兒童可以在學校免費拿牛奶。

content.en: All that milk isn't cheap. Taiwan will pay more than one billion Taiwan dollars every year!
content.tw: 這麼多的牛奶並不便宜，每年需要多花超過十億台幣。

content.en: Some kids can't drink milk. But that's okay! They don't have to drink it. They are getting a kind of soy milk. It can also help their bones and teeth become stronger.
content.tw: 有一些兒童沒辦法喝牛奶，他們可以得到豆漿，一樣可以強化骨頭跟牙齒。

content.en: Milk helps kids to be strong and healthy. Now kids in Taiwan can drink more milk, for free! Kids here will be stronger and healthier. That's great! Let's drink some milk together. Cheers!
content.tw: 牛奶幫助孩子們強壯又健康。現在台灣的孩子們可以免費喝更多的牛奶了！這裡的孩子們將會更強壯、更健康。這真是太棒了！讓我們一起來喝點牛奶吧。乾杯！

vocabulary.preface: 全台灣的小學生，從這學期開始每星期可以喝兩次免費鮮奶。

content.text:
1. have to 必需。
Wait, will you drink your milk? 等一下，你要喝牛奶吧?
Do I have to? I'm already full! 一定要喝嗎?我已經飽了。

2. drink 喝。
Then just drink half a glass. 那就喝半杯。
It'll make you grow taller.會讓你長更高。
I'm already tall. 我已經很高了。
That's true.那倒是真的。

3. bone 骨頭。
It'll give you healthy bones too. 牛奶也會給你健康的骨頭。
And healthy bones let me jump high and run fast. 健康骨頭讓我跳得高，跑得快。
Exactly! 完全正確!

4. soy milk 豆漿。
I'm happy you know that! 我真高興你知道。
How about soy milk? Is it good too? 那豆漿呢，也很好嗎?
Yeah, as good as milk.對，跟牛奶一樣好。

vocabulary.postscript: Let's all drink more milk and soy milk. 一起來讀單字。have to必需 drink喝 bone骨頭 soy milk豆漿

content.en: Orangutans are smart apes. Sadly, there aren't many of them. Their rainforest homes are getting too small. They live in Indonesia and Malaysia. These countries are south of Taiwan.
content.tw: 紅毛猩猩是聰明的人猿。可惜牠們越來越少，因為居住的雨林越來越小。牠們住在東南亞國家印尼跟馬來西亞。

content.en: Did you know orangutan means "forest person"? They live in trees. Their long arms help them go from tree to tree!
content.tw: orangutan 的意思是「森林裡的人」。牠們就住在森林裡，長長的手臂可以讓牠們在樹跟樹之間擺盪。

content.en: One day, two orangutans had a fight. One orangutan's cheek got a big wound. Ouch!
content.tw: 有一天，兩隻紅毛猩猩打架，其中一隻的臉頰上出現很大的傷口。

content.en: Scientists saw him get some leaves. He chewed them. But he didn't eat them. He made juice... in his mouth!
content.tw: 科學家看到這隻紅毛猩猩採了葉子，牠沒有吃下去而是咀嚼，把葉子的汁液留在嘴巴裡。

content.en: He put the juice on his wound. Then he put the chewed leaves on the wound. The leaves were like a bandage!
content.tw: 牠把汁液敷在傷口上，再把嚼過的葉子當繃帶保護傷口。

content.en: The next day, the scientists saw him get new leaves. He put juice and chewed leaves on his wound again. His wound got better!
content.tw: 隔天科學家又看到牠做同樣的事，而且牠的傷口好多了。

content.en: The scientists were surprised! They had watched orangutans for twenty years. But they did not see other orangutans do this. How did this orangutan learn? The scientists don't know.
content.tw: 科學家很驚訝，他們觀察紅毛猩猩20年，從來沒有看過這種行為。那這隻紅毛猩猩從哪裡學的呢? 他們也不知道。

content.en: But the scientists are happy. Maybe people will care about orangutans now! How about you?
content.tw: 但科學家很高興。也許現在人們會關心紅毛猩猩了！你呢？

vocabulary.preface: 紅毛猩猩懂得用植物來醫治傷口，這可聰明了!

content.text: 1. country 國家。Which country has the most orangutans? 哪個國家有最多紅毛猩猩?Let's see… Brazil? 我想想看。巴西嗎?It has the biggest rainforest. 它有最大的雨林。
2. forest 森林。Nope. Guess again. 不對，再猜。They do live in forests, right? 牠們確實住在森林裡吧?That's right. 對。Then Thailand. 那是泰國。
3. smart 聰明的。No, no. But you're getting closer.不對，不過靠近了。Okay, this is my last try. Myanmar. 好吧，這是最後一次猜。緬甸。You're smart, but still no. 真聰明，但還是錯了。
4. ape 猿猴。Tell me.告訴我。I'll let you find it out. 我讓你自己找。Those apes…Where can they go? 那些猿猴能去哪兒?

vocabulary.postscript: 今天的單字你記得嗎?country國家 forest森林 smart聰明的 ape猿猴

c. He was in a fight.

content.en: This year, the world came together for the Summer Olympics. It was in Paris.
content.tw: 全世界都在上個月為了巴黎奧運聚在一起 !

content.en: Many countries compete in many sports. Some sports are swimming and running. Other sports use guns. Skeet uses guns.
content.tw: 許多國家都會參與各項比賽。有些運動是游泳和跑步，也有些運動要使用到槍。定向飛靶射擊比賽就需要用到槍。

content.en: In skeet, an athlete shoots two flying discs. They're eleven centimeters wide. That's small!
content.tw: 定向飛靶射擊比賽，選手必須射中兩個飛靶，都只有 11 公分寬，非常的小 !

content.en: The athlete says "Pull!" Then the discs fly out very fast! One flies from the left! One flies from the right! Then... Bang! Bang! The athlete shoots two times. He tries to hit both discs. That's hard!
content.tw: 當選手說:「pull ! 放飛靶」時，兩片飛靶會很快地從左右兩邊飛出來，然後...選手發射兩次，要試著打中兩片飛靶，真困難!

content.en: Lee Meng-yuan is the first Taiwanese skeet athlete at the Olympics. He's 29 years old. He began shooting when he was six.
content.tw: 李孟遠是第一個參加奧運的台灣定向飛靶選手，他今年二十九歲，他從六歲就開始射擊。

content.en: Lee competed against 29 athletes first. He did very well! Then he competed against five. He won a bronze medal!
content.tw: 李孟遠一開始和其他二十九個選手比賽，他表現得非常好，一路晉級，最後和五個選手競爭，他贏得了銅牌!

content.en: It's Taiwan's first shooting medal. And it's Taiwan's first Paris Olympics medal!
content.tw: 這是台灣在射擊項目上的第一面獎牌。同時也是台灣在巴黎奧運的第一面獎牌！

vocabulary.preface: 定向飛靶射擊難度很高，而李孟遠奪得奧運銅牌。

content.text: 1. sports 運動. Of all those Olympic sports, which one would you choose? If I were to join the Games?假如我要參加的話嗎??
2. swim 游泳. Definitely not badminton. 絕對不是羽球。I'll lose every game.每場比賽我都會輸。I can't swim either. 我也不會游泳。
3. run 跑. Maybe pole vault. 也許撐竿跳。Yeah, I can do that. 那個我可以。You want to be a pole vault athlete? 你要當撐竿跳運動員?Yeah, I like running and jumping.我喜歡跑和跳。
4. win 贏得. And when I win, when I receive the gold medal, everyone will come to congratulate me... 我贏的時候，拿金牌，大家都會來恭喜我。Oh, cut it out, Nancy! 好啦，南西!

vocabulary.postscript: 來一起讀單字。 sports運動 swim游泳 run跑 win贏得

quiz.question: 1. What sport does Lee Meng-yuan do?
2. Which medal did Lee Meng-yuan win?
3. How many athletes did Lee Meng-yuan compete against first?

title: Super Light Shoes Made With Spray

content.en: Ready… Set… Go! Look at them run! What a race! How do they run so fast?
content.tw: 你看他們跑步! 真是精采的一場賽跑! 他們怎麼能跑這麼快?

content.en: The Paris Olympics was this summer. The fastest runners in the world were there.
content.tw: 巴黎奧運在今年夏天舉行，全世界跑得最快的選手都聚集在那裡。

content.en: Hellen Obiri was there. She's from Kenya, an East African country. She's one of the greatest marathon runners.
content.tw: Hellen Obiri 也參加了比賽，她來自東非國家肯亞。她是最優秀的馬拉松跑者之一。

content.en: Marathon runners run over 42 kilometers! Heavy things make them slower. So the clothes they wear are light. Their shoes are light too!
content.tw: 馬拉松選手要跑超過 42 公里! 重的東西都會讓他們慢下來，所以他們穿很輕的衣服，鞋子也不例外。

content.en: Hellen wears some of the lightest shoes in the world. A robot makes them! It sprays a very long, very thin string!
content.tw: Hellen 穿著世界上最輕的鞋子。這種跑鞋由機器人製作，製作時，它會噴出一條很長很細的線!

content.en: Robots spray string to make a shoe? Whose idea is this? It's a university student's idea. He saw kids make spider webs for Halloween. They used strings of glue.
content.tw: 機器人噴出細線來做鞋子? 這是誰想出來的主意呢?這是一個大學生的點子，他看到小孩為了萬聖節，用膠做出細細的線來做蜘蛛網，因此得到了靈感。

content.en: Hellen won a big marathon in these shoes. They helped her win a medal at the Paris Olympics too! Run, Hellen, run!
content.tw: Hellen 穿著這雙鞋贏得了一場重要的馬拉松。這雙鞋也幫助她在巴黎奧運上贏得了一枚獎牌！跑吧，Hellen，跑吧！

vocabulary.preface: 跑鞋讓特別的機器人來做，又輕又快又好。

content.text: 1. runner 跑步的人。 Why do so many marathon runners come from Kenya? Not only Kenya. Some are from Ethiopia.
2. African 非洲的。 That's also an East African country. True. And both are big.
3. fast 很快的。 Runners there can run fast for a long time. Yeah, and they're used to hot weather.
4. long 長的。 So running long distances in Paris was not a problem for them. No, but it was for many others.

vocabulary.postscript: 你今天學了哪些單字?runner跑步的人 African非洲的 fast很快的 long長的

2. How far do people run in a marathon?
3. When did the student get the idea for these shoes?

title: Bikes Make Electricity at Keelung Port

content.en: Riding a bike is very good exercise. But, did you know you can make electricity doing this?
content.tw: 騎腳踏車是一項很好的運動，但你知道騎腳踏車可以發電嗎?

content.en: Bike riders can make about 100 watts of electricity in one hour. That can charge a smartphone, a tablet, a laptop, or a TV!
content.tw: 騎腳踏車一小時能產生100瓦的電力，可以充手機、平板、電腦或電視機。

content.en: But the bikes stay in the same place. And they need some equipment to make electricity. This is not easy to do at home.
content.tw: 但是腳踏車要停在同一個地方，而且需要一些設備才能發電。想要在家做可不容易。

content.en: But... do you want to try making electricity on a bike? You can do this at Keelung Port. They have new bikes that make electricity!
content.tw: 想不想試試騎腳踏車發電呢? 你可以在基隆港做，他們有能夠發電的腳踏車!

content.en: When you ride one, you can charge your phone or tablet. A screen shows how much electricity you are making on the bike.
content.tw: 當你騎在發電腳踏車上，可以給自己的手機或平板充電。車上的螢幕會顯示你發了多少電。

content.en: People are excited about Keelung Port's new bikes! On the first day, more than one hundred twenty people tried them.
content.tw: 大家對基隆港這種腳踏車都很興奮! 第一天推出時，超過 120 個人去使用。

content.en: People love making electricity on these bikes! They say riding these bikes is healthy. They say these bikes are good for the environment.
content.tw: 人們很喜歡騎這些腳踏車發電! 他們說這不但有益健康，對環境也很有幫助。

content.en: Now Keelung Port is going to have more of these bikes!
content.tw: 現在基隆港將會推出更多這種腳踏車！

vocabulary.preface: 騎腳踏車來發電，一舉兩得!

content.text:
1. charge 充電。
Oh no, the power is out! 糟糕，停電了!
Now how am I going to charge my laptop? 我現在要怎麼給筆電充電?
And how can I cook without power? 沒電我怎麼煮飯?

2. ride 騎。
I've got an idea.我有個主意。
Let me move my exercise bike here. 我把運動腳踏車搬來這。
What for? 為什麼呢?
Riding it can create power! 騎車可以發電啊!

3. try 嘗試。
You can certainly try. 你當然可以試試看。
But I don't think it'll create enough. 但是我想它的發電量不夠。

4. hour 小時。
I've been riding for an hour. 我已經騎了一個鐘頭了。
Yeah, and all it does is light up this little bulb.沒錯，但是只點亮了一個小燈泡。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字簡短好記。
charge充電 ride騎 try嘗試 hour小時

2. What can a bike's electricity charge?

content.en: Space looks empty! What's out there? Well, there are planets, moons, stars, and more. Are there aliens? Hmmmm ... Are there diamonds? Yes, you heard that right: diamonds!
content.tw: 太空看起來空蕩蕩的，有些什麼東西呢? 有行星、衛星、恆星等等。會有外星人嗎?還是鑽石?

content.en: Scientists are studying Mercury. Mercury is the closest planet to the sun. It has a lot of carbon. It's gray because of carbon. There's carbon inside Mercury too.
content.tw: 科學家研究離太陽最近的水星，發現它有很多碳，地底下也有，所以水星是灰色的。

content.en: What happens when carbon is pressed very hard in a very hot place? Diamonds are made!
content.tw: 碳在溫度極高的地方被緊緊擠壓，會發生什麼事? 會變成鑽石。

content.en: Billions of years ago, Mercury was very hot. The carbon inside Mercury was pressed very hard. So scientists think maybe diamonds were made. They think the diamonds are in a layer.
content.tw: 幾十億年前，水星的溫度非常高，碳又在高壓狀態。科學家認為水星的一個地層裡面可能蘊藏了很多鑽石。

content.en: The diamond layer is very thick. Scientists think it is fifteen to eighteen kilometers thick! That's a lot of diamonds! But don't get too excited! We can't wear these diamonds.
content.tw: 鑽石層非常厚，科學家認為大約有15到18公里的厚度，那可是很多很多的鑽石哦。但是先別高興，我們沒辦法佩戴這些鑽石。

content.en: These diamonds are five hundred kilometers deep down inside Mercury. We can't get them.
content.tw: 因為這些鑽石埋在水星地底下深達500公里，我們拿不到。

content.en: Learning about Mercury's diamonds helps scientists learn about other planets. What more will they find?
content.tw: 學習水星的鑽石有助於科學家了解其他行星。他們還會發現什麼呢？

vocabulary.preface: 水星上也許有數不清的鑽石，但是距離地球人太遙遠了

content.text:
1. wear 穿戴。
That's a beautiful ring! 好漂亮的戒指! This is the first time I see you wearing it. 這是我第一次看你戴。
Yeah, it's from my boyfriend.是啊，我男朋友送的。

2. excited 興奮的。
A diamond ring from him?! 他送鑽戒?!
Yeah, I got very excited when he gave it to me.對啊，他送我時我好興奮呢!

3. think 想。
So did he propose? 所以他有求婚嗎?
Not yet. 還沒有。
What's he waiting for? 他在等什麼?
I think he wants to buy a house first. 我想他要先買房子。

4. carbon 碳。
Well, a diamond is a diamond. 鑽石總是鑽石。
Yeah, although it's just hard-pressed carbon. 對，雖然它只是被用力擠壓的碳。

vocabulary.postscript: 請注意，來一起讀今天的單字。wear穿戴 excited興奮的 think想 carbon碳

2. What are diamonds made from?
3. Why can't we get the diamonds inside Mercury?
options: c. They're five hundred kilometers deep.

title: Students Want to Save Deer from Cars

content.en: Deer are beautiful animals. It's exciting to see them in a forest. But it's not good when a deer is on a road. That's very dangerous.
content.tw: 鹿是美麗的動物，在森林看到牠們會讓人很開心。但是鹿如果出現在道路上就糟糕了，那會很危險。

content.en: A deer can die when a car hits it. People can get hurt too.
content.tw: 鹿被車子撞到可能會死掉，人也可能受傷。

content.en: In the U.S., two high school students want to help deer. They want to make a device. It can help stop cars from hitting deer. It has a camera. It also uses artificial intelligence, or AI.
content.tw: 美國有兩個高中生打算製造一個裡面裝有人工智慧相機的設備，讓車子不會再撞到鹿。

content.en: How does the device work? The AI camera watches a road. It sees a car... And it sees a deer near the road! Then the device makes sounds!
content.tw: 它是怎麼運作呢? 這個AI相機會監視道路，當它拍到一隻鹿靠近車輛時，便會發出聲音!

content.en: They are animal sounds. Maybe they're bear sounds! Maybe they're lion sounds! These sounds scare the deer. It runs away! It doesn't go onto the road.
content.tw: 它發出的是動物的聲音，也許是熊或獅子的吼叫聲，這些聲音會把鹿嚇跑，就不會跑到道路上。

content.en: The students got a prize for their idea. They won $15,000 U.S. dollars. That's about $480,000 Taiwan dollars! Wow!
content.tw: 這個點子讓學生贏得了一萬五千元美金，相當於四十八萬台幣!!

content.en: Now the students can make their device. Maybe they can make lots of them! Deer need help. Nobody wants cars to hit deer!
content.tw: 現在學生們可以製造他們的設備了。或許他們可以大量製造！鹿需要幫助。沒有人希望車子撞到鹿！

vocabulary.preface: 用科學技術保護野生動物，真是好辦法!

content.text: 1. scare 驚嚇。Here comes the deer. 那隻鹿來了。Wow! … shhhh! It's so beautiful! 牠真美! Yeah. 是啊。But it's eating your flowers! 但是牠在吃你的花! Do you want to scare it away? 你要把牠嚇走嗎?
2. stop 制止。Why do I want to do that? 為什麼要那樣? To stop it from ruining your garden! 好讓牠不要毀了你的花園!
3. sound 聲音。It's okay. Just some flowers. 沒關係，只是幾朵花而已。Hey, those are my vegetables! 嘿，那是我種的青菜! Maybe you can make some dog sounds.你也許可以學狗叫。
4. run away 跑掉。Woof, woof! There, it's running away. 好了，牠跑掉了。But I feel bad about it. 但是我覺得不開心。

vocabulary.postscript: 你有看過野生的鹿嗎? 來讀單字。scare驚嚇 stop制止 sound聲音 run away跑掉

quiz.question: 1. What kind of sounds does the device make?
2. What does the device see when it makes sounds?
options: a. A forest and a road
b. A lion and a bear
c. A deer and a car

quiz.question: 3. What did the students win?

content.en: People lived in Taiwan thousands of years ago. We don't know a lot about them. Sometimes we find their things. These things can help us learn more. But sometimes the things are a mystery.
content.tw: 幾千年前，就有人類在台灣生活，我們偶而也會找到一些那些人的遺跡。不過有時候找到的東西是個謎。

content.en: A tall, thin stone stands in Taitung. It's very, very old. The top is a half-moon shape.
content.tw: 在台東，有一根又高又細的石柱，非常古老，頂端是半月形的。

content.en: What was the stone for? Maybe it was for a building. Maybe it was for an important person. Nobody knows. This stone is a mystery.
content.tw: 石柱有什麼用處呢?也許是建築的一部份，或是某人的紀念碑。沒有人知道。

content.en: The stone is in Peinan Site Park. It's near a train station. About forty years ago, Taitung wanted to make the station bigger.
content.tw: 這根石柱位於卑南遺址公園，靠近火車站。 40 年前，台東政府想把車站改得更大。

content.en: Workers started to dig. They found some old things! Scientists came. The scientists found more than 2,000 very old and important things!
content.tw: 工人們開挖時，發現一些很古老的東西! 科學家來了，找到 2000多個古代的重要物品!

content.en: These things were used by people thousands of years ago. Now they are Taiwan's treasures! Peinan Site Park was made to protect them.
content.tw: 幾千年前的人類使用過這些物品，現在它們是台灣的寶藏，卑南遺址公園的建立就是為了保護它們。

content.en: The museum there helps us learn about these treasures and the people who used them. But the museum doesn't know what the stone was for.
content.tw: 這一座博物館幫助我們了解古代的人，但是專家還是不懂石柱的意義。

content.en: What do YOU think the stone was for?
content.tw: 你覺得這塊石頭是做什麼用的呢？

vocabulary.preface: 卑南遺址公園很受考古人員的重視。

content.text:
1. dig 挖掘。
Isn't it cool? 那不是很酷嗎?
To dig up something that's from hundreds of years ago? 挖出幾百年前的東西?
It is cool.是很酷。

2. find 找到。
But I would hope to find something special.不過我會希望找到一些特別的。
Like gold coins. 好比說金幣。

3. ago 之前。
I once watched a movie. 我看過一部電影。
They dug up a boat! From over one thousand years ago. 他們挖到一艘船!
來自一千多年前的船!

4. stone 石頭。
Wow, that's really something! 哇，那真棒!
Right? 是不是?
I want to find stone buildings, just like Pompeii.
我想要找到石頭建築，像龐貝城那種。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起複習今天的單字。
dig挖掘 find找到 ago之前 stone石頭

2. When were many very old things found?
3. Why was Peinan Site Park made?
options: b. To make a train station bigger

title: A Very Long Short Space Trip

content.en: In June, two astronauts were excited. They were flying a spaceship to the ISS. That's the International Space Station.
content.tw: 六月時，兩個很興奮的太空人，駕著太空船飛到了 ISS，也就是國際太空站。

content.en: Astronauts try new things in space there! These things help us learn more about space.
content.tw: 太空人要嘗試很多新事物，幫助我們更了解太空。

content.en: The ISS is also a big space home. Some astronauts live there for six months. Some visit for a short time. The two astronauts were going to visit for eight days.
content.tw: 國際太空站是個大型的太空之家，兩個太空人原本要住在那裡八天。

content.en: But their spaceship had some problems. It has small engines. They help the spaceship fly. But some small engines didn't work well. Scientists on Earth didn't know why. But the two astronauts got to the ISS safely.
content.tw: 他們順利到了國際太空站，但是太空船的引擎出了問題! 科學家們都找不出原因。

content.en: The engines were not easy to fix. So the astronauts didn't fly home after eight days. They didn't fly home after eight weeks!
content.tw: 引擎很難修理，所以他們在太空站待了 8 個星期都還沒回家!

content.en: Then the engines were fixed. But was the spaceship safe for the astronauts? The scientists didn't know.
content.tw: 引擎最後修好了，但科學家不確定太空船安不安全。

content.en: So the astronauts will use another spaceship. And they will fly home... next year, in February!
content.tw: 所以這兩位太空人會使用另一艘太空船˙，不過要等到明年 2 月才能回到家 !

content.en: The astronauts' eight-day trip will be an eight-month trip! Everyone will be very happy when they come home!
content.tw: 太空人原本預計八天的旅程將變成八個月的旅程！當他們回家時，大家都會非常開心！

vocabulary.preface: 原本要在國際太空站待八天的兩名太空人，結果必須待上八個月。

content.text:
1) spaceship 太空船。
The spaceship that took two astronauts up there in June
六月時把兩個太空人送上去的太空船….
Yeah, I remember. 對，我記得。
…has come back without them.回來了，沒有帶他們。

2) safely 安全地。
It's back on Earth.它回到了地球。
That's right. NASA didn't believe it could come back safely.
對，太空總署不相信它可以安全回來。

3) month 月份。
What about the two astronauts? 那兩個太空人呢?
Oh, they'll just be up there,他們就會待在上面，
watching the moon and stars for months.欣賞月球跟星星好幾個月。

4) fly 飛行。
Too bad they can't just fly back. 真糟糕，不能直接飛回來。
Do you want to fly to space? 來一起讀單字。
